  <ol style="margin-top: 6px; margin-bottom: 10px;">
    <li>A primary offering in an IPO sells only existing shares and raises no cash for the firm</li>
    <li>A secondary offering increases the number of shares outstanding</li>

  </ol>

  <strong style="display: block;">Which statements are FALSE?</strong>

  <label><input type="radio" name="module1_multia_q2" value="A"> A. 1 and 2</label><br>

  <label><input type="radio" name="module1_multia_q2" value="D"> D. All of them</label><br>

<div id="feedback-module1_multia_q2" class="feedback" data-status="" style="display:none;">
âœ… Correct: A. Statements (1) and (2) are false (statement (3) is true).
Why the false statements are false:
- (1) A primary offering issues new shares, increasing shares outstanding and raising cash for the firm (secondary offerings sell existing shares).
- (2) A secondary offering sells existing shares (often by insiders); it typically does not increase shares outstanding or raise new cash for the firm.
